info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 6:05PM MDT until June 24 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 605 PM MDT, Thunderstorms which have produced heavy rainfall along the southeastern edge of the Trout Fire Burn Scar have mostly shifted east of the burn area. Radar estimates and gauge readings suggest 1 to 1.5 inches of rain fell on the eastern edge of the burn area, but with more moderate amounts around 0.50 inches towards the heads of the burned canyons. Light to moderate rain is expected to persist over the burn area for at least another hour or two.
Flooding may still impact canyons flowing north towards Sapillo Creek, including Hill Canyon and Skates Canyon, and will be more likely in the canyons flowing east towards the Mimbres River, including Three Circle, Soldiers, Cottonwood, and Bear Canyons.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Trout Fire Burn Scar.
SOURCE...Radar and gauge reports.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Trout Fire Burn Scar.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lake Roberts, San Lorenzo, Sherman, Mimbres, San Juan, Lake Roberts Heights, Camp Thunderbird and Upper Mimbres Valley.
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Trout Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
